00028 int sendall(const int sock, const char *buf, const size_t len)
00029 {
00030         size_t tosend = len;
00031         while (tosend > 0) {
00032                 ssize_t bytes = send(sock, buf, tosend, 0);
00033                 if (bytes <= 0) 
00034                         break; // send() was not successful, so stop.
00035                 tosend -= (size_t) bytes;
00036                 buf += bytes;
00037         };
00038 
00039         return tosend == 0 ? 0 : -1;
00040 }

00048 int recvline(const int sock, char *buf, const size_t buflen)
00049 {
00050         int status = 0; // Return status.
00051         size_t bufleft = buflen;
00052 
00053         while (bufleft > 1) {
00054                 // Read one byte from scoket.
00055                 ssize_t bytes = recv(sock, buf, 1, 0);
00056                 if (bytes <= 0) {
00057                         // recv() was not successful, so stop.
00058                         status = -1;
00059                         break;
00060                 } else if (*buf == '\n') {
00061                         // Found end of line, so stop.
00062                         *buf = 0; // Replace end of line with a null terminator.
00063                         status = 0;
00064                         break;
00065                 } else {
00066                         // Keep going.
00067                         bufleft -= 1;
00068                         buf += 1;
00069                 }
00070         }
00071         *buf = 0; // add null terminator in case it's not already there.
00072 
00073         return status;
00074 }

00080 int process_config_line(char *line, struct config_params *params)
00081 {
00082         // Ignore comments.
00083         
00084         if (line[0] == CONFIG_COMMENT_CHAR)
00085                 return 0;
00086 
00087         // Extract config parameter name and value.
00088         char name[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00089         char value[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00090 
00091         char temp_char[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00092         int temp_int[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00093 
00094         int items = sscanf(line, "%s %s\n", name, value);
00095         int int_item =  sscanf(line, "%s %d\n", temp_char,temp_int);
00096 
00097         // Line wasn't as expected.
00098         if (items != 2)
00099                 return -1;
00100 
00101         // Process this line.
00102         if (strcmp(name, "server_host") == 0) {
00103                 strncpy(params->server_host, value, sizeof params->server_host);
00104                 counter1++;
00105         } else if (strcmp(name, "server_port") == 0) {
00106                 if(int_item != 2)
00107                         return -1;
00108                 params->server_port = atoi(value);
00109                 counter2++;
00110         } else if (strcmp(name, "username") == 0) {
00111                 strncpy(params->username, value, sizeof params->username);
00112                 counter3++;
00113         } else if (strcmp(name, "password") == 0) {
00114                 strncpy(params->password, value, sizeof params->password);
00115                 counter4++;
00116         }else if(strcmp(name, "table") == 0){
00117 //check duplicate table name            
00118                 int i = 0;
00119                 while(params->table[i] != NULL)
00120                 {
00121                         if(strcmp(params->table[i],value)==0)
00122                         {
00123                                 counter1 = 2;
00124                                 return -1;
00125                         }
00126                         i++;
00127                 }
00128                 params->table[counter5] = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char));
00129                 strcpy(params->table[counter5], value);
00130                 params->table[counter5+1] = NULL;
00131                 counter5++;
00132         }
00133         // else if (strcmp(name, "data_directory") == 0) {
00134         //      strncpy(params->data_directory, value, sizeof params->data_directory);
00135         //} 
00136         else {
00137                 // Ignore unknown config parameters.
00138         }
00139 
00140         return 0;
00141 }

00144 int read_config(const char *config_file, struct config_params *params)
00145 {
00146         int error_occurred = 0;
00147 
00148         // Open file for reading.
00149         FILE *file = fopen(config_file, "r");
00150         if (file == NULL)
00151                 error_occurred = 1;
00152 
00153         // Process the config file.
00154         while (!error_occurred && !feof(file)) {
00155                 // Read a line from the file.
00156                 char line[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00157                 char *l = fgets(line, sizeof line, file);
00158 
00159                 // Process the line.
00160                 if (l == line)
00161                         process_config_line(line, params);
00162                 else if(counter1 != 1 || counter2 != 1 || counter3 != 1 || counter4 != 1)
00163                         error_occurred = 1;
00164                 else if (!feof(file))
00165                         error_occurred = 1;
00166         }
00167 
00168         return error_occurred ? -1 : 0;
00169 }

00171 /*
00172  *  logger   : log messages from both client and server side
00173  *  message  : the message to log
00174  *  logging  : constant to determine whether to log to stdout or the respective client and server files
00175  *  is_server: a bit indicator determining whether log command comes from server or client side  
00176  */
00177 void logger(char *message, int logging, int is_server) {
00178 
00179     // Create the prefix including the time for all logging messages
00180     char prefix[255];
00181     time_t ti;
00182     struct tm * t;
00183     time ( &ti );
00184     t = localtime ( &ti );
00185     sprintf(prefix, "LOG -> %d-%d-%d-%d-%d-%d :: ", t->tm_year+1900, t->tm_mon+1, t->tm_mday, t->tm_hour, t->tm_min, t->tm_sec);
00186 
00187     // IF logging == 1 log messages to the stdout
00188     if (logging == 1) {
00189         // Server messages come with a newline, so just output message
00190         if (is_server == 1) {
00191             printf("%sSERVER :: %s", prefix, message);
00192         }
00193         // Client messages come without a newline, so append a newline character
00194         else {
00195             printf("%sCLIENT :: %s\n", prefix, message);
00196         }
00197     }
00198     // If logging == 2 log messages to a file and flush file to ensure immediate update of file
00199     else if (logging == 2) {
00200         // Log to the server file
00201         if (is_server == 1) {
00202             fputs(prefix, sfp);
00203             fputs(message, sfp);
00204             fflush(sfp);
00205         } 
00206         // Log to the client file
00207         else {
00208             fputs(prefix, cfp);
00209             fputs(message, cfp);
00210             fputs("\n", cfp);
00211             fflush(cfp);
00212         }
00213     }
00214 }

00216 char *generate_encrypted_password(const char *passwd, const char *salt)
00217 {
00218         if(salt != NULL)
00219                 return crypt(passwd, salt);
00220         else
00221                 return crypt(passwd, DEFAULT_CRYPT_SALT);
00222 }

00224 int checkreturnmessage(char* message)
00225 {
00226         char state[50];
00227         sscanf(message, "%s", state);
00228         if(strcmp(state, "S")==0)
00229         {
00230                 return 0;
00231         }
00232         else if(strcmp(state, "E")==0)
00233         {
00234                 char errorcode[50];
00235                 sscanf(message, "%s %s", state, errorcode);
00236                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "PARAM")==0)
00237                 {
00238                         return 1;
00239                 }
00240                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL")==0)
00241                 {
00242                         return 2;
00243                 }
00244                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "ERR_NOT_AUTHENTICATED")==0)
00245                 {
00246                         return 3;
00247                 }
00248                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "AUTH")==0)
00249                 {
00250                 
00251                         return 4;
00252                 }
00253                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "TABLE")==0)
00254                 {
00255                 
00256                         return 5;
00257                 }
00258                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "KEY")==0)
00259                 {
00260                         
00261                         return 6;
00262                 }
00263                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "ERR_UNKNOWN")==0)
00264                 {
00265                         
00266                         return 7;
00267                 }
00268                 if(strcmp(errorcode, "ERR_TRANSACTION_ABORT")==0)
00269                 {
00270                         
00271                         return 8;
00272                 }
00273         }
00274         return -1;
00275 }

00277 int checkinvalidparam(const char* cmdline, int detectspace)
00278 {
00279         int count = 0;
00280         if(detectspace==0)
00281         {
00282                 while(cmdline[count]!=NULL)
00283                 {
00284                         if(isalnum(cmdline[count])==0)
00285                         {
00286                                 return -1;
00287                         }
00288                         count++;
00289                 }
00290         }
00291         else if(detectspace==1)
00292         {
00293                 while(cmdline[count]!=NULL)
00294                 {
00295                         if(cmdline[count]==' ')
00296                         {
00297                                 ;
00298                         }
00299                         else if(isalnum(cmdline[count])==0)     
00300                         {
00301                                 return -1;
00302                         }
00303                         count++;
00304                 }
00305         }
00306         return 0;       
00307 }
